question_content.barrons:question: The two executives were a study in contrasts: where the chief financial officer was (i)________ keeping accurate records and famous within the company for her (ii)________, the chief executive officer was far more liberal in his spending habits and not particularly known for (iii)________ recordkeeping.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
meticulous about; economy; scrupulous.

The key phrase here that unlocks the entire sentence is the chief executive officer was far more liberal in his spending habits. That is your clue that the second missing word is economy (thriftiness). The CFO is known for thriftiness and for being meticulous (thorough; painstaking) about keeping accurate records. In contrast, the CEO is known for being a free spender and for not being scrupulous (conscientious; thorough) about keeping good records.

Overwhelmed by is incorrect. Nothing suggests that keeping accurate records would have

overwhelmed the CFO.

Restricted to is incorrect. It makes little sense to say that the CFO was restricted (limited) to keeping

accurate records.

Meekness is incorrect. Nothing suggests the CFO was famous for meekness (humbleness; timidity).

Eccentricity is incorrect. Nothing suggests the CFO was famous for eccentricity (oddness; peculiarity).

Intuitive is incorrect. Intuitive (innately perceptive) makes no sense in the context of record-keeping.

Manifest is incorrect. Manifest (evident; obvious) makes no sense in the context.
